channel.title: Dicing Removed From Runescape
channel.description:
Today we have taken the step to disable dice in the game. From today they will no longer work, and next week we will remove them all from the game. This was due to the amount of scamming and general “bad use” of these ingame dice items. While we strongly believe that what you do with your treasure is entirely up to you, we have had to step in to deal with this issue. What do we mean by “bad use” of dice items? Well, gambling for GP was never the intention of the dice. There is no support for PvP gambling within RuneScape and we do not intent to add any. Gambling is a risky pastime and nobody should ever rely on gambling to make money. Also, there was a high degree of scamming or general bad behaviour when using dice, particularly since the removal of bots a few weeks ago. While we hope that players are “streetwise” enough to recognise a scam, it’s not always the case. Sometimes we have to step in and change the game. Apologies for not doing something sooner. Since we brought back free trade we really have tried to leave it up to the player to decide what’s right and wrong. But the overwhelming feedback from the forums is that we have to just stop the problem. Don’t gamble! There are too many people who will try to scam you or alter the odds in their favour. It’s never supported by JAGEX unless it’s about gameplay (like the duel arena). It’s likely that dice scammers will move over to another method of trying to scam you, so please, be vigilant and remember... if it sounds too good to be true, it’s probably a lie. Just don’t do it. Mod_mark RuneScape Lead Designer
No need to advertise your goldselling website thanks.

item.title: Dicing Removed From Runescape
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie

@Ollie wrote:

Don’t consider them a risk, I will only go forward if I know enough about the situation.

remember, always have a plan B.

item.title: Dicing Removed From Runescape
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

OK, making GP fast in the game is an addiction, gambling is one of the methods to do so, people will always risk if they think they can win.

Personally I’m not a gambling man, I only take calculated risks!

Read full topic

item.title: Dicing Removed From Runescape
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Can’t say I didn’t anticipate this.

Ollie:

Gambling is an addiction, where there is demand there will be supply.

Hopefully this isn’t quite true yet, and it’s just the fad of looking for some way to make easy GP but the emergence of all these other chance based games tells me differently. Of course Jagex can only blame themselves for this one.

Read full topic

item.title: Dicing Removed From Runescape
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Ollie:

Gambling is an addiction, where there is demand there will be supply.

I agree with this, but we’re talking about kids. The RuneScape demographic is full of children with limited capacities of understanding. I doubt they are going to pickup some of the more complicated means of gambling.

As for the connection one, it’s pure stupidity. It’s just going to turn the whole gambling world into a scamming perspective for regular users. Their chat box might say they had the first message, even though the server processed it differently for the other users. It will never be fair.

Read full topic

item.title: Dicing Removed From Runescape
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:21, topic:421760”]all that video shows is someone with a few claws and bandos chest plates?

earning money in the game is pretty easy thou, maniown stole ~300m off me after I trusted him with my account, I quit for a while and signed up again and within 3 days earn’t back upto 50m.

easy way to make money and to level is to do slayer with rapier, extremes (ovls if hard task) and turm, and keep bonecrusher with you when killing anything dropping bones / big bones.[/quote]

You’ve got to turn the audio up extremely high to hear what he’s saying

This is another game they’re trying to do now, the toy horsey you buy from draynor says one of a few(maybe 3?) messages when you click it.

Read full topic

It’s a joke

I agree that being scammed in a game is your own fault, and might teach you a lesson for real life situations. And disabling it also takes away freedom from the players. But I think there might be legal reasons behind this too. Perhaps allowing gambling in a game that’s accessible to kids is against some law somewhere.
[/quote]But it isnt accessible to kids, they have an age limit.[/quote]
13 -> 17 is still a child, though?
